intro: Spermacoce poaya var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy false nightshade, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
